abstract: Obama administration moves to roll back numerous rules that apply to hospitals and other health care providers after concluding that standards are obsolete or overly burdensome to industry.
snippet: Declaring certain requirements obsolete or burdensome, the Obama administration proposed changes it said would save health care providers about $1.1 billion annually.
lead_paragraph: Declaring certain requirements obsolete or burdensome, the Obama administration proposed changes it said would save health care providers about $1.1 billion annually.

headline.main: U.S. Moves to Cut Back Regulations on Hospitals
headline.print_headline: U.S. Moves To Cut Back Regulations On Hospitals
headline.seo: Obama Administration Seeks to Roll Back Hospital Rules
